title: What is the purpose of the spells tab?
body: Seems like the most unnecessary thing at the very most it could be ever so slightly helpful to some super new players but really they likely don't even realize it's there and the spell descriptions are on spells anyway. There are heaps of things they could use the spells tab for I would like if they did something useful with it.

replies.body:
It's not hurting anybody, and it's not causing UI clutter. There aren't -really- enough tabs or necessary new features to warrant replacing it with something else, and it just gives players a way to access and read at their own pace the types and effects of all the spells in the game. 

Perhaps they could even stand to add a few things to the description, such as a suggested class/position, or something akin to "(Damage) Great for finishing off wounded foes without committing to a chase, also a very effective counter for champions with higher health regeneration or life steal. (Ignite)" ; "(Support) Perfect for securing a kill against an agile opponent or to prevent hasty escapes, also significantly reducing their damage output. Can be used both defensively and offensively (Exhaust)"

But in its current form I don't see much of an issue really. I don't know if this still applies but when the game came out you could always spot a new player as they had revive picked by default. Game manuals are rare nowadays and not everyone does their research of the game outside the client so having a clean description of all of the in-game effects and spells is fair enough, wouldn't you say? Or you'll have people asking "is there anywhere in the game where I can read about the different spells other than when I have to select a champion within a set period of time?"

If they had the option to keep it and add other tabs I wouldn't complain about it but I remember Riot saying something about how they can't add more tabs for some reason.
